infoDrawer.title: Variable Builder
infoDrawer.description: Manage global system variables that can be used in chatbot flows. Define variables, their types, default values, and whether tenants can configure them.
infoDrawer.whatAreVariablesPoint1: Allow centralizing common information (e.g., company name, phone number).
infoDrawer.whatAreVariablesPoint2: Can be used dynamically in chatbot responses.
infoDrawer.whatAreVariablesPoint3: Some variables can be configured by each tenant.
infoDrawer.whatAreVariablesPoint4: Can be marked as sensitive to avoid direct exposure.
infoDrawer.administrationPoint2: Organize variables by categories and verticals.
infoDrawer.administrationPoint3: Define data types and validation rules.
infoDrawer.administrationPoint4: Set whether a tenant can modify the value.

form.internalNameHelp: Unique identifier used in code (only letters, numbers, and underscores).
form.descriptionPlaceholder: Description of this variable and its usage
form.typeEditWarning: Type cannot be changed once the variable is created.
form.tenantConfigurableHelp: If enabled, each tenant can customize the value.
form.sensitiveHelp: If enabled, the value will be hidden in the interface.
form.selectDefaultHelp: Must match one of the options defined below.

validation.nameFormat: Only letters, numbers, and underscores are allowed.
validation.typeRequired: You must select a variable type.
validation.defaultValueNotInOptions: Default value must be one of the defined options.
validation.optionsRequired: You must define at least one option.
validation.atLeastOneOption: You must complete at least one option with value and label.
